summary: The TANF State Expenditure Integrity Act of 2025 aims to prevent and address the misuse of subrecipient funds within the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) program. It mandates the Secretary of Health and Human Services to develop a framework for monitoring subrecipient spending to identify intentional misuse, establishes a TANF Program Integrity Unit, and requires annual reports to Congress. The bill also introduces penalties, including requiring states to replace misused funds by providing cash assistance to families below the poverty line. Furthermore it addresses the publication of new regulations for how the amendments outlined in this bill will be implemented. Finally, it outlines when the changes will take effect.
